New Records: JJ Bleday surpassed Dave Henderson for most doubles in a single season among primary A's center fielders since the team moved to Oakland in 1968 with his 39th double of the season.
Key Match Events: JJ Bleday hit a first-pitch fastball 104.4 mph off the bat into left-center for his 39th double of the season.
The A's won 4-3 over the Astros in 12 innings at Minute Maid Park.
The A's took the lead in the top of the 12th with two runs as three consecutive batters bunted before left-hander Hogan Harris finished it off in the bottom half.
Post-Match Reflections: JJ Bleday expressed his surprise and excitement about breaking the record.
A's manager Mark Kotsay praised Bleday's improvement and work ethic.
A's starting pitcher JP Sears commented on Bleday's comfort and defensive improvement.
JP Sears mentioned the fun and motivation of playing in a playoff-like atmosphere despite not making the playoffs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The A's will be closing the chapter on their time at the Oakland Coliseum and playing their home games at Sutter Health Park in West Sacramento for the 2025-27 seasons before a planned relocation to a new ballpark in Las Vegas.
